title: Aston Villa respond to Man Utd approach for Ollie Watkins
body_text:
Manchester United have made an approach to sign Aston Villa striker Ollie Watkins, according to reports.
Ruben Amorim is keen for United to add a new striker to his squad ahead of the new Premier League season.
Deals for Matheus Cunha and Bryan Mbuemo have already been completed to bolster United’s attacking options this summer, but Amorim wants another experienced central striker to ease the burden on Rasmus Hojlund, who scored just four goals in the Premier League last season.
So far this summer, United have been rejected by Liam Delap, who went on to join Chelsea in a £30m deal from Ipswich Town, while Hugo Ekitike turned down an approach from Amorim’s side and opted to move to Liverpool instead.
According to The Telegraph, United have now turned to Watkins and an approach has been made to Villa over the 29-year-old’s availability.
However, Villa are said to have told United that they are not willing to entertain offers for their striker.

Watkins was the subject of a £40 million bid from Arsenal in the January transfer window but Villa turned down the offer from Mikel Arteta’s side.
The striker was also unhappy with Unai Emery after he was benched for both of Villa’s Champions League quarter-final legs against Paris Saint-Germain in April.
‘We’ve put in a lot of hard graft the last few years to get to that position. And obviously I played 20 minutes against PSG in both games,’ Watkins said.
‘I’m not going to lie. I was fuming I wasn’t playing and I let him know that.
‘But he’s the manager at the end of the day and you’ve got to respect his decision, but I’m not one of those players that’s happy to sit on the bench.’
Watkins, who joined Villa in a £33m deal from Brentford in 2020, finished last season with 17 goals in all competitions.
United, meanwhile, have also failed with an offer to sign goalkeeper Emiliano Martinez on loan from Villa.

The Argentina international, who was in tears as he waved goodbye to Villa fans in the final home game of last season, is understood to be keen on a move to Old Trafford.
Villa have set a £40m asking price for Martinez, who is currently with the squad for their pre-season tour in the United States.
United are in the market for a new goalkeeper due to Andre Onana’s inconsistent performances in his two seasons at the club. The Cameroon international will also miss the majority of United’s pre-season campaign due to a hamstring injury.
